name: df-ph
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(ccphlo, cin(cnv, coprab(s0, s1, s2, wral(s3, crn(cv(s0)), wral(s4, crn(cv(s0)), wceq(co(co(cfv(cv(s2), co(cv(s3), cv(s0), cv(s4))), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cfv(cv(s2), co(cv(s3), cv(s0), co(cneg(nat1), cv(s1), cv(s4)))), cexp, nat2)), co(nat2, cmul, co(co(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4)), cexp, nat2)))))))))
comment: Define the class of all complex inner product spaces. An inner product space is a normed vector space whose norm satisfies the parallelogram law (a property that induces an inner product). Based on Exercise 4(b) of [ReedSimon] p. 63. The vector operation is ` g ` , the scalar product is ` s ` , and the norm is ` n ` . An inner product space is also called a pre-Hilbert space. (Contributed by NM, 2-Apr-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)
